New York City is facing a state of emergency to support food banks, while significant developments include the approval of a 12,000-unit rezoning in Jamaica, swift restoration of gas services after a leak, and ongoing legal challenges regarding health plan changes for city workers.

### Risks & Alerts

- New York declares state of emergency to fund food banks amid rising food insecurity. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Swift response restores gas service at 140 Claremont Avenue after leak report.
